title: To-Do
description: A simple todo application.
author: William

title: Pong
description: The famous pong game from the seventies. Maybe add an AI or multiplayer?
author: William

title: Tic Tac Toe
description: The famous tic tac toe game. Maybe add an AI or multiplayer?
author: William

title: The Calculator
description: A simple calculator application that can compute basic arithmetic.
author: William

title: Movie Database
description: A database for movies, with search, add, and delete functionality.
author: William

title: Chess
description: A game of chess against an AI or another player.
author: William

title: Emoji Translator
description: Translator app that converts human written text into emoji-script.
author: William

title: Vending Machine
description: A virtual vending machine that can dispense and display different items.
author: William

title: Todays Word
description: An app that displays a selected word for the day with some interesting information to it.
author: William

title: Hangman
description: The classic hangman game where one player (or computer) selects a word, and the other tries to guess it.
author: William

title: Number Guessing Game
description: Guess a secret number randomly picked between 1 and 100.
author: William

title: Public Transport
description: An app that shows the timetable for trains and public transport nearby.
author: William

title: Movie Quotes
description: There are plenty of fun and interesting movie characters Maybe write a program that prints random quotes from your favorite characters or a specific movie? Mix and match? Add some ASCII art of the characters to make them come alive, or maybe even a speech synthesizer if you want to go the extra mile.
author: Mark

title: Cowsay Replica
description:
Recreate the classic Cowsay program, and add your own characters
Cowsay is a program that generates ASCII art pictures of a cow with a message. It can also generate pictures using pre-made images of other animals, such as Tux the Penguin, the Linux mascot.
author: Steven

title: The Matrix
description: Everyone loves the visual effect of the falling binary code rain in The Matrix.  Recreate the famous Matrix rain effect of falling green characters in a terminal yourself .
author: Frank J

title: Terminal Image Viewer
description: Trying to make an image viewer terminal application, see if you can fiddle around with different methods of rendering images for low resolution console displays. Maybe attempt some ASCII art approach, or may be something were advanced such as marching cubes based on contrast differences?.
author: Jsph7

title: Timer
description:
A timer that is configurable and count downs to 0, then alerts the user that the time is up.
Easy to build for the web, a bit harder for console applications.
author: Peterson K

title: Password Generator
description: In todays society, it is important to secure online accounts with strong passwords Build a program that can generate secure passwords through any interface or command line program. Make it as nice and detailed as you can.
author: Dave

title: Roll The Dice
description: Now you might have ended up here by chance, which is a bit ironic. In this challenge, you will program an app where you can roll the dice or generate random choices of any shape. The results should be displayed in some nice way, maybe render an ASCII dice?.
author: Marcus F

title: Live Clock
description:
A nice display that shows the clock Take on the challenge of building the terminal or the web How advanced clock can you create?
Choose whether it should be analog or digital, AM  PM or 24-hour.
author: Anonymous
